body: nit: missing a space after the `:` here.
diff_hunk:
@@ -1396,11 +1397,13 @@ UniValue listtransactions(const JSONRPCRequest& request)
             "                                         'send' category of transactions.\n"
             "    \"confirmations\": n,       (numeric) The number of confirmations for the transaction. Negative confirmations indicate the\n"
             "                                         transaction conflicts with the block chain\n"
+            "    \"generated\": xxx,         (bool) Only returns true if transaction is a coinbase one\n"
             "    \"trusted\": xxx,           (bool) Whether we consider the outputs of this unconfirmed transaction safe to spend.\n"
             "    \"blockhash\": \"hashvalue\", (string) The block hash containing the transaction.\n"
             "    \"blockindex\": n,          (numeric) The index of the transaction in the block that includes it.\n"
             "    \"blocktime\": xxx,         (numeric) The block time in seconds since epoch (1 Jan 1970 GMT).\n"
             "    \"txid\": \"transactionid\", (string) The transaction id.\n"
+            "    \"walletconflicts:\"hashvalue\", (array) List of txid with which this transaction is conflicting.\n"

body: Matches the description from the `listreceivedbylabel` [help](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/src/wallet/rpcwallet.cpp#L1243).

body: I'd rather pull this out into a static const RPCResult in a moveonly commit, since it is used in three places. And then only update that single place with the documentation. We do that in other places (like getmempoolentry)

body: Concept ACK
The coinbase is the input. The output is simply generated.

body: Doesn't a transaction including a coinbase input qualify as a coinbase one ? We don't enforce this wording strictly if the rest of the codebase I think.

body: Updated at fbc3c9f as suggested in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/16689#discussion_r317160287 (but only output from WalletTxToJSON as we may have small diffs between RPCs for other fields)
This line should not be deleted.
diff_hunk:
@@ -1393,19 +1411,8 @@ UniValue listtransactions(const JSONRPCRequest& request)
             "    \"label\": \"label\",       (string) A comment for the address/transaction, if any\n"
             "    \"vout\": n,                (numeric) the vout value\n"
             "    \"fee\": x.xxx,             (numeric) The amount of the fee in " + CURRENCY_UNIT + ". This is negative and only available for the \n"
-            "                                         'send' category of transactions.\n"

body: While extracting this, it wouldn't hurt to fixup the nits that wouldn't be worth a commit on their own, like adding the missing period at the end of this sentence and next sentence.

e.g. s/chain
"/chain.
"/ and s/one
"/one.
"/

Suggestion: s/Only returns true if transaction is a coinbase one./True if the transaction is a coinbase, otherwise false./

Though https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/16689#discussion_r317281171 should be handled first.
It would be nice to align the horizontal spacing of this entire section.
Grammar fix: s/List of txid with which this transaction is conflicting./List of txids that conflict with this transaction./

body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#16539](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/16539.html) (wallet: lower -txmaxfee default from 0.1 to 0.01 BTC by Sjors)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.
Agree.
